@kathy26585260 @ReallyAmerican1 Is that a supplemental plan?  What do you pay for it?  All of my bills are covered with no co-pays and no restrictions on who I can see after an annual $200 deductible.

So not only will your rates likely go up, you also have to deal with your deductible if you have to run it through insurance first, which most of us likely would, since you only qualify if your insurance doesn't cover it all. 🙃

@michaelmalice My company is paying $28,000 a year for my private health insurance. I’m still paying another $5,000 in premiums. And then another $6,000 to hit my deductible.

It wasn’t this bad before Obamacare. A death spiral for the consumer/patient, not the insurance provider.
